items.title: Fail to validate schema when documentRoot is array
items.body:
I'm trying to define a schema for a document where the `documentRoot` is an array. For example:

```json
[
  {"name": "John"},
  {"name": "Jane"}
]
```

```yml
- name: Person
  doc: |
    A person                                                                                                                                                                      
  type: record
  fields:
    name:
      type: string

- name: DocumentRoot
  doc: |
    Array of People
  documentRoot: true
  type:
    type: array
    items: Person
```

When I try to validate that schema using `schema-salad-tool`, I get the following error message:

```
/Users/dfornika/miniconda3/envs/schema-salad/bin/schema-salad-tool Current version: 5.0.20200302192450
While validating schema `test.yml`:
test.yml:9:3:   Object `test.yml#DocumentRoot` is not valid because
                 - tried `SaladRecordSchema` but
test.yml:13:3:     the `type` field is not valid because
                     value is a CommentedMap but expected a string
test.yml:9:3:     - tried `SaladEnumSchema` but
                   * missing required field `symbols`
test.yml:13:3:     * the `type` field is not valid because
                     value is a CommentedMap but expected a string
test.yml:9:3:     - tried `Documentation` but
test.yml:13:3:     * the `type` field is not valid because
                     value is a CommentedMap but expected a string
test.yml:12:3:     * invalid field `documentRoot`, expected one of: 'name', 'inVocab',
                   'doc', 'docParent', 'docChild', 'docAfter', 'type'
```

I'm using `schema_salad` version `5.0.20200302192450`, from conda-forge

items.title: --codegen python: have normal __init__ , add method for parsing from a doc
It is hard to use schema-salad as a library due to its exception structure
items.body:
`schema-salad-tool` is a very useful tool to validate the given CWL documents.
However, there are several problems when we use it as a library to be embedded in other tools.

It is mainly the problem of the exceptions.

- All the information is already serialized to the strings when we catch the exceptions.
  - This is the main blocker to implement [cwl-language-server]()
  - We expect that we can get the error information such as file name, line number, column number and the message what is wrong with the document from the exception by using field access such as `exception.file_name`.
  - However, we only get a string in the following format:
    ```console
    $ schema-salad-tool /path/to/v1.0/CommonWorkflowLanguage.yml /path/to/document.cwl
    /Users/tom-tan/.pyenv/versions/3.6.5/bin/schema-salad-tool Current version: 4.2.20190326201446
    Document `/path/to/document.cwl` failed validation:
    /path/to/document.cwl:3:1:  Field `cwlVersion` contains undefined
                                                    reference to
                                                    `file:///path/to/v1.0a`
    /path/to/document.cwl:14:1: checking field `inputs`
    /path/to/document.cwl:15:5:   checking object
                                                       `/path/to/document.cwl#reference`
    /path/to/document.cwl:16:5:     Field `type` references
                                                         unknown identifier `Fileu`, tried
                                                         file:///path/to/document.cwl#Fileu
    ```
    - We have to parse the above string even if schema-salad knows each elements in its internal.
      - It is better to provide API to get the elements directly rather than forcing the library users to parse the strings.
    - schema-sald reads environment variables such as `$COLUMNS` and inserts newlines not to wrap the messages *when the exception objects are generated*. It makes tooooo hard to make tests for the generated error messages.
      - #233 is a real example what is needed to add tests for it.
- It may throw several types of exceptions and there does not exist a top level exception for schema-salad.
  - It does not fit use cases where he or she wants to catch only exceptions from the schema-salad.
- It may throws generic exception classes object such as `RuntimeError` even if it is an error of parsing.
  - It is better to use other exception classes for schema-salad rather than generic exception classes such as `RuntimeError`.

The latter two problems are relatively easy to solve.
However, I am not sure there is a good way to solve the first problem with several small PRs (I hate large PR because it is hard to review and it makes slower to be merged).

Note: schema-salad has code generation feature for the given schema but codegen-ed parsers have the same problems.

items.title: remove dependency on avro/avro-cwl
items.body:
- [x] Run the `schema_salad`, `cwltool` unit tests and the CWL conformance tests while measuring the line coverage of the avro library.
- [x] Remove everything that wasn't used and move the remaining code into `schema_salad`
- [x] refactor and condense

items.title: Remove hook set by past.autotranslate
items.body:
In [__init__.py](https://github.com/common-workflow-language/schema_salad/blob/master/schema_salad/__init__.py#L32) the past.autotranslate function is used. This function hooks the Py2Fixer loader to sys.meta_path.  This is an unwanted side effect and can result in errors when importing schema_salad in python 3 code (see [this issue](https://github.com/nlppln/nlppln/issues/27))

I think the hooks  need to be removed at some point:
```python
from past.translation import remove_hooks
remove_hooks()
```

items.title: Fix Py3 on appveyor
items.body: See https://ci.appveyor.com/project/mr-c/schema-salad/build/.276-master

items.title: If TMP or HOME not in os.environ, ref_resolver.fetch_text fails
items.body:
When `ref_resolver.Loader` creates a session, it initializes a FileCache, passing a string in as the octal file mode. When attempting to write to the cached file, a `TypeError('an integer is required')` because the file mode is a string.

https://github.com/common-workflow-language/schema_salad/blob/6ce2b9abe8adcbbd21833d266b2a278ba5b140c3/schema_salad/ref_resolver.py#L293

This is missing an `os.path.join()`, like the others in the function.

I encountered this running CWL's load_tool in a web application, under an apache process that does not have HOME or TMP set.

Additional info in https://github.com/Duke-GCB/bespin-api/issues/128

items.title: [Question] What is the license for a parser generated by `--codegen`?
items.body:
I am curious about the license for a parser generated by `--codegen` option.
Is it licensed under Apache-2.0 (i.e. same as that for schema_salad) or others?

items.title: A codegen-ed parser accidentally omit a property for `DockerRequirement`
items.body:
I reproduced this issue with schema_salad 2.6.20180214144209 and Python 3.6.2.
I used the following CWL file (echo.cwl) for parsing.

```cwl
requirements:
  - class: DockerRequirement
    dockerPull: docker/whalesay
class: CommandLineTool
cwlVersion: v1.0
baseCommand: cowsay
inputs:
  - id: input
    type: string
    inputBinding: {}
outputs:
  output:
    type: stdout
stdout: output
```

## How to reproduce

```console
$ git clone https://github.com/common-workflow-language/common-workflow-language.git
$ schema-salad-tool --codegen python common-workflow-language/v1.0/CommonWorkflowLanguage.yml > cwl_parser.py
$ python
>>> import cwl_parser
>>> cwl = cwl_parser.load_document('echo.cwl')
>>> cwl.requirements[0].dockerPull
```

## Expected result
I want to get the following output:
```console
'docker/whalesay'
```

## Actual result
I got the following message:
```console
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: 'InlineJavascriptRequirement' object has no attribute 'dockerPull'
```

items.title: Resolving absolute http URIs from file base path breaks on Windows
items.body:
The fixes in #120 added a regression, as now on win32 the below resolution of an absolute path is wrong:

```python
fetcher.urljoin("file:///C:/Users/fred/foo.cwl", "http://example.com/bar/soup.cwl")
```

returns `file://example.com/bar/soup.cwl` instead of the `http` URI as-is.

The [code in question](https://github.com/common-workflow-language/schema_salad/pull/120/files) is kind-of trying to follow [RFC 8089 Appendix E.2](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8089#appendix-E.2) - which highlight another edge case:

```python
fetcher.urljoin("file:///d:/baz/soup.cwl", "/foo/soup.cwl")
```

should then preserve the `d:` drive and become `file:///d:/foo/soup.cwl`

items.title: document /tmp fix for Windows+Py3
items.body:
- [x] File issue with `futurize`
- [x] Send PR correcting their code
- [x] Explain that this is a temporary workaround, include links to the issue filed with `futurize` near https://github.com/common-workflow-language/schema_salad/pull/125/files#diff-b56d3fcf71d64c4538a319d61012ca04R18 https://github.com/common-workflow-language/schema_salad/pull/127

items.title: Python 3.x support for schema_salad
items.body:
### Get passing test locally (tox) and on travis CI in python 3.x environment  
Checklist: 
- [x] python-avro support 
- [x] use fixers like modernize and futurize to fix basic issues 
- [x] integrate ``six`` library (majority done)
- [x] handle string literals properly:  ``u" "`` or ``from __future__ import unicode_literals `` (optional for the time being)
- [x] mypy goals
    - [x]  update to latest version of mypy for ``--py2`` mode
    - [x] run in python3 mode
    - [x] now using ``Text`` inplace of ``unicode`` in existing codebase 
    - [x] Add stub files for 3rd party libraries and stdlib to ``typeshed/3`` and ``typeshed/2.7``: [Status](https://github.com/AleksandrSl/schema_salad/blob/python3-support/typeshed.md)
    - [x] update ``Makefile``  
- [x] edit ``.travis.yml``, simplify ``tox.ini``

items.title: Duplicate ID check fails with the same name for input and output
items.body:
When checking for duplicate IDs starting from version 2.5.20170327140858, it's not possible to set input and output with the same name. Both input and output got the same identifier: `file:///blah/blah/blah/task.cwl#some_name` Testing example ```yaml cwlVersion: v1.0 class: CommandLineTool hints: DockerRequirement: dockerPull: ubuntu baseCommand: [touch] inputs: some_name: type: string inputBinding: position: 1 default: hello.txt outputs: some_name: type: File outputBinding: glob: "hello.txt" ```
Detailed log 
         
/usr/local/bin/cwltool 1.0.20170329142446
Resolved 'task.cwl' to 'file:///Users/kot4or/workspaces/cwl_ws/cwl_sandbox/schema_salad_dup_names/task.cwl'
Tool definition failed validation:
task.cwl:15:1: checking field `outputs`
task.cwl:16:3:   checking object `task.cwl#some_name`
task.cwl:9:3:     object id `task.cwl#some_name` previously defined
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/cwltool/main.py", line 686, in main
    fetcher_constructor=fetcher_constructor)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/cwltool/load_tool.py", line 186, in validate_document
    processobj, metadata = document_loader.resolve_all(workflowobj, fileuri)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/schema_salad/ref_resolver.py", line 828, in resolve_all
    self.validate_links(document, u"", all_doc_ids)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/schema_salad/ref_resolver.py", line 994, in validate_links
    raise errors[0]
ValidationException: task.cwl:15:1: checking field `outputs`
task.cwl:16:3:   checking object `task.cwl#some_name`
task.cwl:9:3:     object id `task.cwl#some_name` previously defined

items.title: Roadmap to MS Windows support for schema_salad
items.body:
- [x] Create a separate branch: `windows` and start adding commits to it to get all passing tests on MS Windows. 
- [x] Setup appveyor CI and add `.appveyor.yml` file to the `windows` branch (or any other CI which provides support for Windows builds) 
- [x] Open "standing" / work-in-progress pull request
- [x] Currently allow those test only which do not involve any unix tool requirement.
- [ ] Figure out a way to make failing tests more verbose and passing one as usual. Look into py.test args. 
- [x] Rebase and add commits from `master` into `windows` branch periodically to make sure branch doesn't go stale. 
- [x] When all the tests pass under MS Windows, add Appveyor to the list of tests that must pass before a PR is mergeable.
- [x] Periodically merge into `master` so that there isn't too much divergence

- Only after `schema_salad` is ported to Windows, should we proceed with MS Windows support for ``cwltool``.

items.title: [WINDOWS] ref_resolver.py: DefaultFetcher.fetch_text fails to identify windows path
items.body:
tests: ``test_errors.py``, in method: 
```
def test_errors(self):
        document_loader, avsc_names, schema_metadata, metaschema_loader = load_schema(
>           get_data(u"tests/test_schema/CommonWorkflowLanguage.yml"))
```
details:
the path passed to ``DefaultFetcher.fetch_text`` 
- in windows: ``C:/Users/<path to directory>/schema_salad/schema_salad/tests/test_schema/CommonWorkflowLanguage.yml``: returns unsupported scheme in url 
- in linux: ``file:///mnt/c/Users/manu/Desktop/ubuntu projects/schema_salad/schema_salad/tests/test_schema/CommonWorkflowLanguage.yml``: passes correctly 

Need to modify the ``fetch_text`` function to identify windows path as well.

items.title: Validation checks for duplicate ids
items.body: Validation should include a check that identifiers are not duplicated in a document.

items.title: schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117.tar.gz has unwanted files in it
items.body:
I noticed this while testing a fresh install of Planemo where this was in the install output:

```
Searching for schema-salad==1.12.20160610104117
Reading https://pypi.python.org/simple/schema-salad/
Best match: schema-salad 1.12.20160610104117
Downloading https://pypi.python.org/packages/51/99/cae16cfd2e981702441011e572445e12fdd0f8f69070a8ee13d09109120b/schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117.tar.gz#md5=92635d8e1317aa161f4a35881076dc33
Processing schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117.tar.gz
Writing /tmp/easy_install-42E9pF/schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/setup.cfg
Running schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/setup.py -q bdist_egg --dist-dir /tmp/easy_install-42E9pF/schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/egg-dist-tmp-Jiro6f
  File "build/bdist.macosx-10.11-intel/egg/schema_salad/ref_resolver_BACKUP_28804.py", line 222
    <<<<<<< 973dceb3aeef33920968fa257c7b04885a3a716d
     ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

Adding schema-salad 1.12.20160610104117 to easy-install.pth file
Installing schema-salad-tool script to /usr/local/bin
```

Verified with a direct download of `schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117.tar.gz` from PyPI:

```
$ curl -L -O https://pypi.python.org/packages/51/99/cae16cfd2e981702441011e572445e12fdd0f8f69070a8ee13d09109120b/schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117.tar.gz#md5=92635d8e1317aa161f4a35881076dc33
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
100 56403  100 56403    0     0   198k      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--  198k
$ tar -zxvf schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117.tar.gz#md5=92635d8e1317aa161f4a35881076dc33
...
x schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/schema_salad/ref_resolver_BACKUP_28804.py
...
x schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/schema_salad/ref_resolver_BASE_28804.py
...
x schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/schema_salad/ref_resolver_REMOTE_28804.py
x schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/schema_salad/ref_resolver_LOCAL_28804.py
...
```

One of the four extra files, `schema-salad-1.12.20160610104117/schema_salad/ref_resolver_BACKUP_28804.py` file looks like a failed merge from commit 973dceb3aeef33920968fa257c7b04885a3a716d (Use scopedRef and typeDSL in metaschema), and is therefore not valid Python. e.g.

```
<<<<<<< 973dceb3aeef33920968fa257c7b04885a3a716d

=======
                if "refScope" in value:
                    self.scoped_ref_fields[key] = value["refScope"]
                if value.get("typeDSL"):
                    self.type_dsl_fields.add(key)
>>>>>>> Use scopedRef and typeDSL in metaschema
```

This is fixed in the subsequence release `schema-salad-1.13.20160630144631.tar.gz` (none of these extra files are present) but perhaps something in the build process can be tweaked to prevent this?

items.title: needs entry point for makedoc
items.body:
```
$ schema-salad-tool --print-doc schema_salad/metaschema/metaschema.yml       
TypeError: avrold_doc() takes exactly 6 arguments (2 given)
```

items.title: --version doesn't work
items.body:
```
usage: schema-salad-tool [-h] [--rdf-serializer RDF_SERIALIZER]
                         [--print-jsonld-context | --print-doc | --print-rdfs | --print-avro | --print-rdf | --print-pre | --print-index | --print-metadata | --version]
                         [--strict | --non-strict]
                         [--verbose | --quiet | --debug]
                         schema [document]
schema-salad-tool: error: too few arguments
```

despite

```
schema-salad-tool --help
usage: schema-salad-tool [-h] [--rdf-serializer RDF_SERIALIZER]
                         [--print-jsonld-context | --print-doc | --print-rdfs | --print-avro | --print-rdf | --print-pre | --print-index | -
-print-metadata | --version]
                         [--strict | --non-strict]
                         [--verbose | --quiet | --debug]
                         schema [document]

positional arguments:
  schema
  document

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  --rdf-serializer RDF_SERIALIZER
                        Output RDF serialization format used by --print-rdf
                        (one of turtle (default), n3, nt, xml)
  --print-jsonld-context
                        Print JSON-LD context for schema
  --print-doc           Print HTML documentation from schema
  --print-rdfs          Print RDF schema
  --print-avro          Print Avro schema
  --print-rdf           Print corresponding RDF graph for document
  --print-pre           Print document after preprocessing
  --print-index         Print node index
  --print-metadata      Print document metadata
  --version             Print version
  --strict              Strict validation (unrecognized or out of place fields
                        are error)
  --non-strict          Lenient validation (ignore unrecognized fields)
  --verbose             Default logging
  --quiet               Only print warnings and errors.
  --debug               Print even more logging
```

items.title: tests aren't shipped in PyPI
Unbound variable in schema.py
items.body: What is `r` variable supposed to be in these few lines:  https://github.com/common-workflow-language/schema_salad/blob/master/schema_salad/schema.py#L309 ?

items.title: Please tag releases
ImportError: No module named flatten
items.body: I've tried to run the tool and got the above error. Running with python 2.7.6, and installed in clean virtualenv.
